header.title: Web Workers, PWA & IndexedDB
header.description: Master parallel processing with Web Workers, build offline-capable PWAs with Service Workers, and leverage IndexedDB for client-side storage.

webWorker.title: Web Worker — Browser Multithreading
webWorker.description: Offload CPU-intensive work to background threads

whatIs.title: What is Web Worker?
whatIs.description: JavaScript runs on a single thread, but browsers provide Worker threads to offload CPU-heavy tasks without blocking the main UI thread.
whatIs.separateThread: Separate Thread: Workers run in isolated contexts with no DOM access
whatIs.messagePassing: Message Passing: Communication via postMessage (serialization overhead)
whatIs.transferable: Transferable Objects: Zero-copy transfer for ArrayBuffer

demo.title: Main Thread vs Worker Demo
demo.label: UI Blocking Comparison
demo.animationDesc: Click toggle, then run calculations to see blocking

transferableObjects.title: Transferable Objects
transferableObjects.description: postMessage copies data by default. For large ArrayBuffers, use Transferable Objects to transfer ownership without copying.

sharedArrayBuffer.title: SharedArrayBuffer (Advanced)
sharedArrayBuffer.description: SharedArrayBuffer allows true memory sharing between threads. Use Atomics for synchronization. Requires COOP/COEP headers.

serviceWorker.title: Service Worker & PWA
serviceWorker.description: Build offline-capable web applications with programmable proxy

whatIs.title: What is Service Worker?
whatIs.description: Service Worker is a script that runs in the background, separate from the web page. It acts as a programmable proxy layer between your app and the network.
whatIs.interceptRequests: Intercept Requests: Handle fetch events for custom responses
whatIs.cacheStorage: Cache Storage: Store and serve cached resources
whatIs.backgroundSync: Background Sync: Queue requests when offline

cacheStrategies.title: Cache Strategies
cacheStrategies.label: Interactive Strategy Explorer
cacheStrategies.cacheFirstDesc: Fast, uses cache, falls back to network
cacheStrategies.networkFirstDesc: Fresh data, falls back to cache
cacheStrategies.staleWhileRevalidateDesc: Fast from cache, updates in background

workbox.title: Workbox (Recommended)
workbox.description: Workbox provides a declarative API for common caching patterns, precaching, routing, and more. Highly recommended for production.

indexedDB.title: IndexedDB — Client-Side Database
indexedDB.description: Store large amounts of structured data in the browser

whatIs.title: What is IndexedDB?
whatIs.description: IndexedDB is a low-level API for storing significant amounts of structured data (including files/blobs). Unlike localStorage, it supports transactions and indexing.
whatIs.largeStorage: Large Storage: MB to GB capacity (quota-based)

demo.title: Live Demo
demo.label: IndexedDB Todo App
demo.noTodos: No todos yet. Add one above!
demo.persistMessage: Data persists in IndexedDB. Refresh the page and your todos will still be here!

idbLibrary.title: Using idb Library (Recommended)
idbLibrary.description: The native IndexedDB API is callback-based and verbose. The idb library provides a much cleaner Promise-based interface.

offlineFirst.title: Offline-First Strategy
offlineFirst.description: Design patterns for building reliable offline experiences

philosophy.title: Offline-First Philosophy
philosophy.description: Offline-first means designing your application to work without network connectivity by default. The network becomes an enhancement, not a requirement.
philosophy.localFirst: Local First: Store and read data locally
philosophy.syncWhenPossible: Sync When Possible: Push changes when online

networkStatus.title: Network Status Detection
networkStatus.label: Live Connection Monitor
networkStatus.noHistory: Toggle your network connection to see events
networkStatus.toggleMessage: Try toggling your WiFi or using DevTools Network tab to simulate offline

backgroundSync.title: Background Sync
backgroundSync.description: Background Sync allows you to defer actions until the user has stable connectivity. The Service Worker handles retry automatically.

uxPrinciples.title: Offline UX Principles
uxPrinciples.clearStatusDesc: Always show users when they are offline with visible banners or icons
uxPrinciples.indicateCachedDesc: Let users know when data is from cache vs fresh from server
uxPrinciples.retryOptionsDesc: Provide manual retry buttons for failed operations
uxPrinciples.queueActionsDesc: Save offline actions and process them when back online
uxPrinciples.conflictResolutionDesc: Handle data conflicts gracefully (last-write-wins, merge, user choice)

architecture.title: Offline-First Architecture
architecture.label: Data Flow Pattern
architecture.flowDesc: UI always reads from Local Store. Sync Layer handles server communication.

combined.title: Combined Pattern
combined.description: Integrating Web Worker + Service Worker + IndexedDB

trio.title: The Powerful Trio
trio.description: The most powerful offline-capable web apps combine all three technologies. Each handles a specific concern:

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.communicationItem1: • Use Transferable Objects for large data
bestPractices.communicationItem2: • Implement request/response IDs for async handling
bestPractices.communicationItem3: • Consider Comlink for cleaner Worker APIs
bestPractices.storageItem1: • IndexedDB for structured data and blobs
bestPractices.storageItem3: • Clear old data with versioned cleanups

comlink.title: Comlink for Cleaner APIs
comlink.description: Comlink makes Web Workers feel like local async functions.
